intro: Bredemeyera velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its smooth, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green in color. Bredemeyera velutina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
